title: Scout the Road
description: Ride ahead of the column. Mark any trouble before we march into it.

success.text: You spot a bandit ambush and warn the column. The captain himself thanks you.

failure.text: You rode past the signs of an ambush. Men died. The blood's on your hands.

decline.text: The lieutenant's face hardens. A scout who won't scout is no use to anyone.

title: Long Distance Message
description: Carry urgent orders to the allied force three days' ride north. Don't spare your horse.

success.text: You ride hard through bandit country and arrive in time. The allied lord toasts your name.

failure.text: Bandits caught you on the road. You lost the message and nearly your life. The captain is furious.

decline.text: The captain stares at you in disbelief. 'I thought you had spine,' he says coldly.

title: Train the Levies
description: The lord conscripted peasants. Turn them into something resembling soldiers.

success.text: By week's end they can hold a line. The lieutenant commends your patience and skill.

failure.text: You broke their spirit instead of building it. They're more scared of you than the enemy.

decline.text: 'Find someone else to babysit farmers?' The lieutenant's voice is ice. You've made an enemy.

title: Bargain for Supplies
description: The quartermaster wants grain and ale from the nearby village. Negotiate a fair price.

success.text: You get a fair deal and leave the villagers satisfied. The company eats well tonight.

failure.text: You paid too much for too little. The quartermaster calls you a fool. The men go hungry.

decline.text: The captain trusted you with this. His disappointment is worse than any curse.

title: Track the Enemy
description: Enemy scouts were spotted yesterday. Find their camp and count their strength.

success.text: You find their camp and mark every tent. The captain uses your intel to plan the assault.

failure.text: They spotted you first. You barely escape. Now the enemy knows we're coming.

decline.text: The captain's eyes turn cold. A man who won't scout the enemy won't stand in the line either.

title: Oversee Distribution
description: The quartermaster is sick. Manage today's food and equipment distribution.

success.text: Every man gets his share. No fights, no complaints. The lieutenant is impressed.

failure.text: Some got double rations while others went without. Fistfights erupt. You lost control.

decline.text: 'Not your problem?' The lieutenant's tone makes clear it is now.

title: Command the Patrol
description: Take five men and sweep the forest south of camp. Clear out any bandits.

success.text: You find and scatter a small bandit camp. No losses. Your men would follow you anywhere.

failure.text: You walked into an ambush. Two men wounded. They blame your poor leadership.

decline.text: The captain assigns someone else. Your refusal marks you as a coward.

title: Question the Captive
description: We captured an enemy scout. Find out what he knows about their plans.

success.text: He talks. You learn their troop numbers and march route. The lord himself hears your report.

failure.text: He tells you nothing but lies. The captain wastes men on false information. He's not pleased.

decline.text: The captain's jaw tightens. 'No stomach for hard questions?' His respect for you dies.

title: Liaise with Allies
description: Friendly troops camped nearby. Coordinate patrols so we don't get in each other's way.

success.text: You work out a good plan. Both forces cover more ground and avoid confusion.

failure.text: Mixed signals lead to gaps in the perimeter. The lieutenant has to fix your mess.

decline.text: The lieutenant goes himself. He notes your unwillingness to represent the company.

title: Survey the Position
description: Walk the defensive line. Report weaknesses before the enemy finds them.

success.text: You mark three weak points and suggest fixes. The captain orders them strengthened immediately.

failure.text: You miss an obvious gap in the stakes. The captain finds it himself and questions your judgment.

decline.text: 'Too busy to check our defenses?' The captain's tone is deadly quiet.

title: Gather Information
description: Go to the town. Listen in taverns and markets. Learn what you can about enemy movements.

success.text: Loose tongues and coin yield good information. The captain presents your findings to the war council.

failure.text: You asked too many questions. Word reaches the enemy that we're watching. Plans must change.

decline.text: The captain trusted you with this delicate task. Your refusal is a personal insult.

title: Act as Sergeant
description: The sergeant is away. Run today's drills and keep the men in line.

success.text: The men respect your authority. The drills go smoothly. The lieutenant nods approval.

failure.text: The men sense your uncertainty and slack off. The lieutenant must step in. You're embarrassed.

decline.text: The lieutenant's face hardens. 'Not ready for responsibility?' He won't forget.

title: Burn Their Supplies
description: Slip into enemy camp tonight. Set their supply wagons ablaze and get out alive.

success.text: The wagons burn. You vanish into the night. Men sing of your deed around the fire.

failure.text: They catch you in the act. You barely escape with your life. The company's plan is ruined.

decline.text: The captain's face shows cold contempt. You were his first choice. Now you're nothing to him.

title: Treat with the Enemy
description: The lord wants terms explored. Ride to enemy camp under flag of truce and gauge their intent.

success.text: You read their position well. The lord values your insight into enemy thinking.

failure.text: You misread their commander. Your report gives false hope. The lord is disappointed.

decline.text: The lord chose you for this honor. Your refusal is seen as cowardice. Your career is over.

title: Manage Equipment Repair
description: Half the company's gear needs mending. Organize the smiths and armorer. Get it done by tomorrow.

success.text: You prioritize the worst damage and keep the smiths busy. By morning, we're battle-ready.

failure.text: You managed it poorly. Important repairs were missed. Men will fight with broken gear.

decline.text: The lieutenant does it himself, working through the night. He remembers you refused.
